titleStmt.title: W. R. Kinney to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1178

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1863-1867

body.p:
Louisville March 26th
His Excellency Thos E Bramlette
Gov Kenty
Dear Sir

Enclosed I send you the petition for the release of James Rouse & ask you to endorse it It is a meritorious case His relatives are all good citizens & mostly Union men -- He is a good man "barring" This rebellion & I have no doubt will behave himself if released
When endorsed please return to me at Hendersonville
